bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Albert E. Truby, November 30, 1941

div1.p: Nogueira would like to know the names of the eleven soldiers who were inoculated by Lazear. He also wants information about the non-immune camp for Americans in Quemados.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Albert E. Truby, November 30, 1941
div1.opener:
TELFS. {FO-7392
{FO-7577
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
UNIDAD SANITARIA DE MARIANAO
SAMA No. 21 - MARIANAO
Marianao November 30 - 1941
General A. E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco- California.
U.S.A.
Dear General:
div1.p:
I deeply appreciate the information you sent me with your letter of
18th inst.- Believe me General, I heartily thank for your kindness, which I will
never forget, for in your report I have found everything I needed for my records.

General, in your letter you inform me that the inoculations practiced by Lazear
on American Volunteer soldiers in August 1900, were eleven in number and I would
like to know possible, the names of said soldiers for I can assure you that in eve-
ry report on research related to this matter I have read, - this is my belief- I
think they are not correct in many of their statement. However, if I could attain
the names of these eleven soldiers, they would be very useful to me in order to
clear definitely this matter. You also state in your letter that Dr Echevarria,
(whom I believe you refer to as Dr Rafel Echevarria, deceased) had in his charge
a camp at Quemados, to Camp there Americans that were not inmune, which when taken t
there, the epidemic had disappeared. I am very interested in knowing if you could
point out the place where said camp was situated, during what period of time it
functioned, and what personnel was in charge of it, and how many persons were ta-
ken there during the time it functioned.

I also wish to state that the name “Truby and Ames Camp” for Yellow Fever “Cases”
is of my own nomination which I use to differ the place where the wards were located
for the attention of Yellow Fever Cases.

Pardon me, dear General, for all the trouble I am causing you wish these lines
but I am taking the liberty of your kindness in behalf of the importance and inte-
rest that all these facts are subject to.

I would appreciate that on the publication of your reports of these investiga-
tions and experiences, have the honor and pleasure of reading them, due to great
knowledge which I am sure I shall obtain from them. Therefore I beg you to let me
know what ever cost this will imply, in order to forward it inmediately.

Thanks again for your kindness, and with my best wishes and many greetings of
the season; I remain:
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours; Dr Pedro Nogueira
Marianao Health Unit.
Director. Dr Pedro Nogueira
Marianao Health Unit.
Sama 21.- Marianao
Havana - Cuba.
